text: So when on the topic /tag listing page, I know you can output the current topic by using `{{ topic }}` but there seems to be an issue where if the topic name contains an ampersand (&) that it strips this out, is there a way to get a value added to the output for the topic/tag listing pages for `{{ topic_name }}` that uses the name of the topic as opposed to the slug? I could code something up to to this but I wasnt sure if it was easy to get it added as a property in the dev info

We made an improvement to list bracket notation to make it more compact. You can now do `list[2:]` and `list[:4]` similar to python slices <http://www.openbookproject.net/books/bpp4awd/ch03.html#slices>
But I noticed this is only applied to the desktop view and not mobile. Is there a special snippet that I should use under @media to embed the same typeface?
you shouldnt need to redeclare it for mobile.
I am trying to just implement another sub-domain to load in the same navigation that uses that new sub-domain
but it only works when I clone that element, had only use the first IF statement specifically calling out that <http://test2.mydomain.com|test2.mydomain.com> domain
<@UD53A9UUR> yea, here is the preview link. It reverts to standard sans serif on my iPhone8 <http://info.castingnetworks.com/studio-shots-by-casting-networks>
